topic: calorie tracking, nutrition, macros, food logging, AI food recognition
audience: Gym-goers & bodybuilders: People bulking or cutting who need fast, accurate macro tracking to hit daily targets without manual logging. | Weight-loss seekers: Individuals who want a simple way to control calories and get visual portion guidance to stay in a deficit.

clips_ranked.hook_text: You know what's crazy about tracking food? Most people just guess their portion sizes.
clips_ranked.full_30s_transcript:
Speaker A: You know what's crazy about tracking food? Most people just guess their portion sizes.
Speaker B: Yeah, and they wonder why they're not hitting their goals.
Speaker A: The worst part is counting every single calorie manually. It's like a part-time job.
Speaker A: I just snap a photo in Cal AI and it spits out calories and macros.
Speaker B: Right, and then you're spending 20 minutes just to log one meal.
Speaker A: Exactly! That's why most people give up after like a week.
Speaker B: There has to be a better way to do this whole thing.
Speaker A: Well, technology is getting pretty wild with food recognition now.

clips_ranked.why_it_fits_app: This moment nails the pain of guessing portions and the grind of manual logging, then pivots to AI recognition as the path forwardâ€”exactly the workflow where photo-based capture removes guesswork and speeds up tracking.

viral_rationale.notes: Hook: "You know what's crazy about tracking food? Most people just guess their portion sizes." On-topic lines: portion sizes, manual calorie counting, 20 minutes to log, food recognition. App line at ~+10s. Connectors used: Yeah, Right, Exactly!, Well.
